page.title: 18Weaste housing & industry
page.content: Housing north of the motorway is a mixture of Victorian terraces (794 987) and (797 987) and local authority houses built in the 1930's. A few houses have been built post-war. The area south of the M602 has been cleared for redevelopment houses here have not yet been built. Many of the houses have small gardens in front with hedges. They have bay-windows and yards at the back. In general, they are in a good state of repair and well painted. The Weaste trading estate has been built on the site of an old cotton mill and twelve small firms making light metal goods occupy nearby factory buildings. South of Eccles New Road towards the canal there is another industrial zone with a large Wimpy (builders) depot and a Lancashire Tar Distillers depot.
